column4: If i don't know the HorizSync and VertRefresh rates of my screen, what should i enter in xorg.conf then?
how do you make it auto?
did it work in the live cd?
if it worked with the live cd, what do you mean?
was your monitor configured properly inside the live cd environmen?
and use it in your system
isn't there a way of getting it to auto detect it?
then just boot into the live cd and email /etc/X11/xorg.conf to yourself then save it over your system configured one that is installed to the HDD
Xorg -configure will make it auto detect?
it will try to detect all your settings
your monitor sync ranges are too low then
well, i did the reconfigure and set it in "medium" mode to 1280x1024 @ 60 Hz....
then maybe your monitor cant handle it
it can. all these problems just appeared after updating the nvidia-glx from the update manager!
